intro: Byrsonima verbascifolia var. intermedia, commonly known as the Brazilian wild cherry or *Cerejeira-do-Brasil*, is a shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its lanceolate, slightly hairy leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers. The plant produces small, hard, dark brown fruits that are often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure.
